website_summaries.verdict: An affordable masonry drill bit set for the number of bits included, but isn't ideal for all masonry drilling.
pros: Features carbide tips and sizes from 1/8" to 1/2"
These bits drill twice as fast as standard bits
Ideal for brick and soft masonry
cons: These bits dull quickly and are not for use with hammer drills

customer_reviews.title: Not for concrete - A waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: Bosch has allowed its good name to be used to market this junk. I bought these to have a variety of sizes in my tool set. I only needed to drill a couple of holes through 1 1/2 concrete. With considerable effort the first 1/4" hole punched through. On the second hole the drill wouldn't even start, a second "new" drill from the set was no better, complete junk. Don't waste money on this cheap made in China junk. Get the real Bosch bits made in Germany. Since I needed to finish the job I made a trip to Lowes and bought the German made Bosch 1/4" bit. Drilled the other three holes with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: H. Q47

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR HAMMER MODE - Rotary mode only bit set
customer_reviews.text: These are NOT FOR HAMMER MODE. This is the Bosch BM 5000 14 Piece Rotary Drill Masonry Bit set, and there is a warning on the cover of the plastic case: "Not for Hammer Mode" "No use en taladros de percusion" "Ne dans des marteuax perforateurs" So while there are lots of hammer drills in the product associations, do not be confused: It is not for use in Hammer Mode. Some other fun facts from the box: -Maximum no load speed 2000 RPM. -Made in China -For use in brick and concrete -(3) 1/8" | (2) 5/32" | (3) 3/16" | (3) 1/4" | 5/16" | 3/8" | 1/2" Otherwise there is nothing wrong with this set. Carry on!
customer_reviews.author: Bozanimal

customer_reviews.title: Can't drill through brick, go figure.
customer_reviews.text: These are completely useless. Tried using them to drill through brick to put a screw in place and they barely dented the brick regardless of speed or pressure used. Tried my regular bit ad confirmed it did an equally poor job as these did. I went through three of the same size bits from this set and could barely get a couple centimetres into the brick. Will be returning these.
customer_reviews.author: Son Tran

customer_reviews.title: They did the job, but weren’t exceptional
customer_reviews.text: They were ok but the smaller bits dulled fairly quickly.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Slow delivery
customer_reviews.text: Drill bits are excellent, but the delivery took 5 days longer than it should have taken, at the outside.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey Boy

customer_reviews.title: No way
customer_reviews.text: Firstly they are "not for hammer drill use" (which makes them useless for masonry anyway). I didn't discover the fine print until I melted 4 points off. They are not sharp either so why would they even market them?
customer_reviews.author: Philip Falso

customer_reviews.title: Not for concrete
customer_reviews.text: Thought all masonary bits were the same, but when I tried using these in concrete, they just kept spinning and did nothing. Junk Looked at the package and it only shows bricks on there.
customer_reviews.author: NVMiner

customer_reviews.title: I used these to drill into a concrete subfloor in ...
customer_reviews.text: I used these to drill into a concrete subfloor in order to install laminate transition pieces and they worked perfectly. They made the job a breeze with a regular 18 volt cordless drill.
customer_reviews.author: Seana B

customer_reviews.title: Gets dull extremely fast.
customer_reviews.text: Be prepared for these to wear out fast. I was drilling new anchors for a nimber plaque into my cinder block house. The first hole cut fairly easily. The second hole barely made it all the way through. The third hole could not make it more than 1/4 inch. I understand now why they give you 2-3 bits of the same size. Without multiple bits, you couldn't finish the smallest job. I expect more durability, especially from a respected name like Bosch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good overall drill bits for softer materials like brick or ...
customer_reviews.text: Good overall drill bits for softer materials like brick or mortar. Not intended to be used with a hammer drill but it works well enough for me. Using a hammer drill I can make a hole through poured concrete. I worked best when I drilled a pilot hole first so the drill bit didn't "wander."
customer_reviews.author: Gmaz

customer_reviews.title: Very good investment.
customer_reviews.text: I installed a hand rail to my front steps. I used a Porter Cable 1/2" drill and this bit set to drill through 2" slate and another 1 1/2" into brick. I needed to install 1/2 " toggle bolts to secure the rail posts. These bits did exactly what I had hoped. Very good investment.
customer_reviews.author: cj385

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: These drill bits are not rated 4 a hammer rotary drill? The lusting does not say that! Why? Returned...
customer_reviews.author: Vova

customer_reviews.title: good set of various sizes
customer_reviews.text: good set of various sizes. really need them for concrete block home. always hanging something in & outside, thanks, bill w.
customer_reviews.author: bill w.

customer_reviews.title: Seems like the bits get dull after 2-3 holes in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems like the bits get dull after 2-3 holes in the drill but still did what they needed to

customer_reviews.title: Good bits for masonry
customer_reviews.text: The bits work well. the box could use some improvement.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent concrete drill bits. The fine quality we have come to expect from Bosch.

customer_reviews.title: I have to be real careful not to let the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have to be real careful not to let the bits overheat too much since I have broken two of the smaller sizes already. They do work but you can't use them for too long.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice concrete bits, they work great on my hammer drill as expected, they plow right through, cinder blocks and bricks

customer_reviews.text: I purchased drill bits for work around the house and they did its job. Vendor provided an accurate description and delivered as promised.

customer_reviews.title: I have been using them on soft masonry with hammer drill and have performed quit well one bit so far I have drilled over 20 holes and the bit still looks in great condition.
customer_reviews.text: The package expressly states not to use hammer drilling and that these are for brick and soft masonry only. I have been using them on soft masonry with hammer drill and have performed quit well one bit so far I have drilled over 20 holes and the bit still looks in great condition.

customer_reviews.title: great set of bits
customer_reviews.text: Very good set... seems to last very well and have done several dozen holes in reinforced concrete with the same bit... still goes in withouth problems... has not lost the "sharpness"

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, but you get what you pay for. Decent price if you have a few holes to drill, but I don't see this set lasting very long with continual work

customer_reviews.title: and they do a good job removing debris from the hole
customer_reviews.text: The masonry bits work well, and they do a good job removing debris from the hole.

customer_reviews.title: good product

customer_reviews.text: Each bit broke or wore off the carbide head after drilling 1 hole in 1/4" porcelain tile.

customer_reviews.title: Not usable with a hammer driver
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why Amazon recommended this product to go with a hammer driver I was buying since they bits cannot be used with a hammer drill.

customer_reviews.title: I like the case it fits in my Ridgid Drill case ...
customer_reviews.text: These coupled with my hammer drill made short work of the holes in 32 yr.-old concrete! I like the case it fits in my Ridgid Drill case well!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are great and do what they are supposed to. Amazon had a nice price for them, successful purchase.

customer_reviews.text: Work well but cannot be used with hammer action therefore not good for very hard materials like concrete block

customer_reviews.title: I love buying things on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I love buying things on Amazon! Great prices and Free Shipping. I'm saving Fuel and Wear on my vehicle! Buy with confidence!

customer_reviews.text: Bosch BM5000 Fast Spiral Masonry Set, 14-Piece works as it should.... it is a Bosch. Would buy again

customer_reviews.title: function and value good. NOT for hammer drills
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on time as advertised. Fit, function and value good. NOT for hammer drills.

customer_reviews.text: No complaints, ate through my brick walls like it was butter!!! Well done Germany!!!

customer_reviews.text: These will get me by. They have a similar deal at regular hardware store for around same price. I broke the smaller one's pretty quickly.

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: Have used 2 of the bits so far in cinder block. No issues.

customer_reviews.title: used it the same day I got them worked great!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a 3/16 bit for cement,used it the same day I got them worked great!

customer_reviews.title: QUALITY CONTROL ISSUES
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to work the one time I used one on a brick. However long term usefulness is problematical because of readily observable QUALITY CONTROL issues. Not one of the drills that are claimed to be the same diameter are the same length. I have not measured diameter but the lengths are all observably different for the same posted diameter. Feel high likelihood of other problems. Not up to expected Bosch standards.
customer_reviews.author: chiker

customer_reviews.title: cheapest bits i've ever used. Made in china junk ...
customer_reviews.text: cheapest bits i've ever used. Made in china junk. do not but these spend the extra money and get something that will last.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: they run out sort of quick but they do the job

customer_reviews.title: Since when did masonry drills be unsuitable for hammer action

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: like butter
customer_reviews.text: drilled through concrete like butter, after pretty much breaking a titanium bit before buying these

customer_reviews.title: Drill  On
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent masonry drill bit set. You get duplicates of the most useful sizes which you will likely need in order to keep a sharp one in the drill.

customer_reviews.title: Sharp!
customer_reviews.text: Did the job without cracking the piece I was drilling a hole in. It's the first time I ever attempted to do something like this and with the right tools I won't be afraid in the future. and the price was great too.

customer_reviews.title: Great for terracotta
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect drills for terracotta. The only problem is that they will warp if you use them to much. So, you have to trade out the bit from time to time. So, far I've only ruined one form over use. Otherwise, they are great. Drills holes quickly without cracking the terracotta.

customer_reviews.title: Very good tools. Also arrived in the mail quite fast
customer_reviews.text: Very good tools. Also arrived in the mail quite fast. Thanks !!

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars

product_meta.title: Bosch BM5000 Fast Spiral Masonry Set, 14-Piece
product_meta.description: Size:14 Piece SetBosch designs the toughest, longest lasting, highest quality drill bits in the industry. Whether you're drilling through wood, metal, glass, tile, brick, plastic, concrete or any other material, Bosch has the bit to fit the job. Double Flute Masonry Drill Bits are to be used in rotary drills only. These bits are not designed for use in hammer drills.
feature_bullets: For drilling in brick, cinder block and tile
Use with corded and cordless rotary drills
Drills twice as fast as standard masonry bits
Carbide tips provide long bit life

specifications.Included Components: Fast Spiral Rotary Masonry Drill Bits
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars232 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
